# The `RegPressureTracker` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Track the current register pressure at some position in the instruction stream, and remember the high water mark within the region traversed. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::RegPressureTracker</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

Track the current register pressure at some position in the instruction stream, and remember the high water mark within the region traversed.

This does not automatically consider live-through ranges. The client may independently adjust for global liveness.

Each <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/regpressuretracker">RegPressureTracker</a> only works within a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a>. Pressure can be tracked across a larger region by storing a <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/registerpressure">RegisterPressure</a> result at each block boundary and explicitly adjusting pressure to account for block live-in and live-out register sets.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/regpressuretracker">RegPressureTracker</a> holds a reference to a <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/registerpressure">RegisterPressure</a> result that it computes incrementally. During downward tracking, P.BottomIdx or P.BottomPos is invalid until it reaches the end of the block or <a href="#a1844e0ed5cc8c90d7afaad0bea1e48d7">closeRegion()</a> is explicitly called. Similarly, P.TopIdx is invalid during upward tracking. Changing direction has the side effect of closing region, and traversing past TopIdx or BottomIdx reopens it.

Definition at line 358 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/registerpressure-h">RegisterPressure.h</a>.

### getMaxDownwardPressureDelta() {#a972fa38378a3d49a9bb48ca584621438}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void RegPressureTracker::getMaxDownwardPressureDelta (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &#42; MI, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/regpressuredelta">RegPressureDelta</a> &amp; Delta, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pressurechange">PressureChange</a> &gt; CriticalPSets, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; unsigned &gt; MaxPressureLimit)</>}>
Consider the pressure increase caused by traversing this instruction top-down.

Find the pressure set with the most change beyond its pressure limit based on the tracker&#39;s current pressure, and record the number of excess register units of that pressure set introduced by this instruction.

Find the register class with the most change in its pressure limit based on the tracker&#39;s current pressure, and return the number of excess register units of that pressure set introduced by this instruction.

This assumes that the current LiveIn set is sufficient.

This is expensive for an on-the-fly query because it calls bumpDownwardPressure to recompute the pressure sets based on current liveness. We don&#39;t yet have a fast version of downward pressure tracking analogous to getUpwardPressureDelta.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/registerpressure-h/#l00494">494</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/registerpressure-h">RegisterPressure.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/registerpressure-cpp/#l01335">1335</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/registerpressure-cpp">RegisterPressure.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getMaxUpwardPressureDelta() {#a41a3118fb6bd46e397256b3c9794b61c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void RegPressureTracker::getMaxUpwardPressureDelta (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &#42; MI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pressurediff">PressureDiff</a> &#42; PDiff, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/regpressuredelta">RegPressureDelta</a> &amp; Delta, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pressurechange">PressureChange</a> &gt; CriticalPSets, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; unsigned &gt; MaxPressureLimit)</>}>
Consider the pressure increase caused by traversing this instruction bottom-up.

Find the pressure set with the most change beyond its pressure limit based on the tracker&#39;s current pressure, and record the number of excess register units of that pressure set introduced by this instruction.

Find the pressure set with the most change beyond its pressure limit based on the tracker&#39;s current pressure, and return the change in number of register units of that pressure set introduced by this instruction.

This assumes that the current LiveOut set is sufficient.

This is expensive for an on-the-fly query because it calls bumpUpwardPressure to recompute the pressure sets based on current liveness. This mainly exists to verify correctness, e.g. with -verify-misched. getUpwardPressureDelta is the fast version of this query that uses the per-SUnit cache of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pressurediff">PressureDiff</a>.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/registerpressure-h/#l00478">478</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/registerpressure-h">RegisterPressure.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/registerpressure-cpp/#l01086">1086</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/registerpressure-cpp">RegisterPressure.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### initLiveThru() {#a474e65b5df97bf9cf404aa9b85eb6262}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void RegPressureTracker::initLiveThru (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/regpressuretracker">RegPressureTracker</a> &amp; RPTracker)</>}>
Initialize the LiveThru pressure set based on the untied defs found in RPTracker.

The register tracker is unaware of global liveness so ignores normal live-thru ranges.

However, two-address or coalesced chains can also lead to live ranges with no holes. Count these to inform heuristics that we can never drop below this pressure.

### isBottomClosed() {#a6b2a46b62294d7923901959892016838}

<MemberDefinition

### recede() {#a126f33e8085746e4f69b4411b61102dc}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void RegPressureTracker::recede (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/registeroperands">RegisterOperands</a> &amp; RegOpers, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/vregmaskorunit">VRegMaskOrUnit</a> &gt; &#42; LiveUses=nullptr)</>}>
Recede across the previous instruction.

This &quot;low-level&quot; variant assumes that <a href="#a354c230443b1586633f5697aec0bcd8e">recedeSkipDebugValues()</a> was called previously and takes precomputed <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/registeroperands">RegisterOperands</a> for the instruction.

If LiveUses is provided, record any RegUnits that are made live by the current instruction&#39;s uses. This includes registers that are both defined and used by the instruction. If a pressure difference pointer is provided record the changes is pressure caused by this instruction independent of liveness.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/registerpressure-h/#l00429">429</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/registerpressure-h">RegisterPressure.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/registerpressure-cpp/#l00754">754</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/registerpressure-cpp">RegisterPressure.cpp</a>.

### bumpDownwardPressure() {#a2b8b6196a7458b6a84480f03e2f1355d}

<MemberDefinition

  labels = {["protected"]}>
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/record">Record</a> the downward impact of a single instruction on current register pressure.

Unlike the advance/recede pressure tracking interface, this does not discover live in/outs.

This is intended for speculative queries. It leaves pressure inconsistent with the current position, so must be restored by the caller.
